lines.text: [On how Christians are by nature gamblers]
We bet that there is a God.
I dare not hope, and yet I must that through this deed I gain your trust.
It is like a kennel for God's angels.
You will preach what you do not believe to men who do not care.
In order that I exist, two gamblers, one obsessive, the other compulsive, must meet.
When Dennis Hasset told Lucinda the baby's history, she had only one thought in mind.
A dream, a lie, a wager - love. This is the story Lucinda gave to my grandfather... and I give to you.

[as Oscar's Great Grandson]
All right. Let's go home.
